intro: Vanda tessellata, commonly known as the tessellated orchid, is a epiphytic orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, brightly colored flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has long, slender stems and broad,革质 (leathery) leaves that help it retain moisture. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Vanda tessellata is popular among orchid enthusiasts for its ornamental value and resilience.
